truth: -  "Income tax is a tax imposed by the government on the financial income of individuals or entities."
fiction: -  "Income tax is a tax imposed by the government on the emotional happiness of individuals or entities."

truth: -  "Sales tax is a tax paid to a governing body for the sales of certain goods and services."
fiction: -  "Sales tax is a tax paid to a governing body for the thoughts and ideas shared during a sale."

truth: -  "Tax evasion is an illegal practice where a person, organization or corporation intentionally avoids paying their true tax liability."
fiction: -  "Tax evasion is a fun game where a person, organization or corporation intentionally hides from tax collectors."

truth: -  "Tax deductions are expenses that can be subtracted from gross income to reduce the total amount of income tax owed."
fiction: -  "Tax deductions are magical spells that can be cast to reduce the total amount of income tax owed."

truth: -  "Capital gains tax is a tax on the profit made from selling something (an 'asset') that has increased in value."
fiction: -  "Capital gains tax is a tax on the happiness gained from selling something (an 'asset') that has increased in value."

truth: -  "Property tax is a tax on the value of a property, typically levied on real estate."
fiction: -  "Property tax is a tax on the number of ghosts residing in a property, typically levied on haunted houses."

truth: -  "A tax credit is an amount of money that taxpayers can subtract from taxes owed to their government."
fiction: -  "A tax credit is a special currency that taxpayers can use to buy goods and services from their government."

truth: -  "Inheritance tax is a tax paid by a person who inherits money or property of a person who has died."
fiction: -  "Inheritance tax is a tax paid by a person who inherits magical powers or abilities of a person who has died."

truth: -  "A progressive tax takes a larger percentage from the income of high-income earners than it does from low-income individuals."
fiction: -  "A progressive tax takes a larger percentage from the happiness of high-happiness individuals than it does from low-happiness individuals."

truth: -  "A regressive tax takes a larger percentage from low-income earners than from high-income earners."
fiction: -  "A regressive tax takes a larger percentage from the dreams of low-dreaming individuals than from high-dreaming individuals."

truth: -  "Tax avoidance is the legal usage of the tax regime to one's own advantage, to reduce the amount of tax that is payable."
fiction: -  "Tax avoidance is the legal usage of magic spells and potions to one's own advantage, to reduce the amount of tax that is payable."

truth: -  "The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) is the U.S. government agency responsible for tax collection and tax law enforcement."
fiction: -  "The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) is the U.S. government agency responsible for collecting dreams and enforcing dream law."

truth: -  "Tax brackets are the divisions at which tax rates change in a progressive tax system."
fiction: -  "Tax brackets are the physical structures where tax collectors hang their hats in a progressive tax system."

truth: -  "A tax lien is a legal claim by a government entity against a noncompliant taxpayer's assets."
fiction: -  "A tax lien is a magical seal placed by a government entity on a noncompliant taxpayer's assets."

truth: -  "A tax refund is a reimbursement to a taxpayer for any excess amount paid to the government."
fiction: -  "A tax refund is a magical potion given to a taxpayer for any excess amount paid to the government."

truth: -  "Taxable income is the amount of income used to calculate how much tax an individual or a company owes to the government."
fiction: -  "Taxable income is the amount of happiness used to calculate how much joy an individual or a company owes to the government."

truth: -  "A tax shelter is a financial arrangement to avoid or minimize tax liabilities."
fiction: -  "A tax shelter is a physical structure where taxpayers can hide to avoid paying taxes."

truth: -  "A tax year is the 12-month period for which tax calculations are made."
fiction: -  "A tax year is the 12-month period during which taxpayers must hibernate."

truth: -  "A tax audit is an official inspection of an individual's or organization's accounts by a government to ensure correct tax payment."
fiction: -  "A tax audit is an official inspection of an individual's or organization's dreams by a government to ensure correct dream sharing."

truth: -  "A tax haven is a country or place with very low "effective" rates of taxation for foreign investors."
fiction: -  "A tax haven is a magical island where taxes do not exist."
